meanings.definition: To provide with too few workers for effective operation.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant had to understaff the kitchen during the busy dinner rush.
meanings.sent2: The small business tends to understaff their customer service department.
meanings.sent3: It was a comedy of errors when the manager decided to understaff the store on Black Friday.
meanings.sent4: The consequences of understaffing the construction site were evident when the project fell behind schedule.
meanings.sent5: Understaffing the hospital led to long wait times for patients in need of urgent care.

meanings.definition: To have an insufficient number of employees.
meanings.sent1: The company tends to understaff their retail locations, leading to long lines at checkout.
meanings.sent2: During the holiday season, many stores may understaff their workforce due to increased demand.
meanings.sent3: The decision to understaff the event security team resulted in chaos at the concert.
meanings.sent4: The consequences of understaffing the hotel were evident when guests had to wait a long time for room service.
meanings.sent5: Understaffing the school cafeteria caused delays in serving lunch to the students.
